channel.title: [Project]: Server from scratch, Project BlueFusion - Recruiting
channel.description:
[b]Welcome to Project BlueFusion[/b]
Project BlueFusion is a second attempt at making a private server. All servers currently are coded off the same base, BlueFusion will be made from 100% scratch. Other then that, no information about the engine can be released.
[u]We are currently recruiting![/u] To join BlueFusion, please post your resume in the following format: [code] MSN: (What is your MSN? This is a requirement!) Experience: (What projects have you done? How long have you been programming? Prove to me you have skill!) Reason: (Why do you want to be on the team?) Offering: (What will you bring to the team?) Other: (Any other information you'd like to include) [/code]
Only experienced programmers will be accepted!
[b]Current State:[/b] * Engine set up * Working on client processing (almost done)
[b]The current source can be downloaded here:[/b] http://www.savefile.com/files/1368964

item.title: [Project]: Server from scratch, Project BlueFusion - Recruiting

item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

pwnm30rdi3:

problem with teams is that they try to release the server that u did all the work on and they get all of the credit. So always work with people that u trust.

thats why you should work this me seeing how half my java knowledge came from you

Read full topic

item.title: [Project]: Server from scratch, Project BlueFusion - Recruiting
item.dc:creator: @ry60003333 ry60003333
item.description:
@ry60003333 wrote:

[quote=“Evil_, post:7, topic:179651”][quote author=Aurai link=topic=240864.msg2040703#msg2040703 date=1202546346]
IDE’s are for narbs I like Eclipse but it takes the fun out of programming, makes it all too easy and organized.
I actually use Notepad++, its always worked great for me.
[/quote]IDE’s help a lot in big projects, I have no idea where you get they are for ‘narbs’…It doesn’t make anything any easier then it already is (Aside from auto-indention which is good and real-time compilation errors) Organization is golden for big projects.

If you’re going for the Autocomplete feature making it too easy, it just saves you time from going through the javadocs looking for what you need.[/quote]

He’s right you know. IDE’s help TONS when developing. With autocomplete it’s like browsing the API by typing, and the auto indentation helps SOO much. Not to mention how easy it is to refactor, move, and copy classes and methods.

I’ve already made a brand new server from scratch with NetBeans, called WorldScape Blitz. If you wanna check out some pics from coding, check our this topic on our forums:
http://rybookrs.onlyplace4.com/forum/index.php?topic=585.0

Read full topic

scratch, as in you’re not going to use a clean source?

Yeah, we’re making this from an empty notepad.
[/quote]…you’re using notepad for a big project…lol…look into Eclipse (Java IDE) it has SVN support for a group to develop a project. Very helpful for projects.[/quote] yeah i use eclipse for when i code it saves time and keeps things neat and does a spell check also tells you if things wont work.

item.description:
@s_p_i_d_a_z wrote:

MSN: jordandurkin@hotmail.com
Experience: Currently working on mrslayerscape and fixing up rickserver v5 lots of bugs good practice
Reason: Because you are a very good coder and I would learn faster from being with people who know what to do
Offering: I know how to make a very good pickup code so this way when you pickup it is just like in real runescape. Also i can bring my humor
Other: I know im sorta new to this but fastest way to learn is to work on it. i can usualy do 4-5hours a day on weekdays and up to 10 on weekends. untill summer

item.title: [Project]: Server from scratch, Project BlueFusion - Recruiting
item.dc:creator: @Aurai Aurai
item.description:
@Aurai wrote:

Welcome to Project BlueFusion

Project BlueFusion is a second attempt at making a private server. All servers currently are coded off the same base, BlueFusion will be made from 100% scratch. Other then that, no information about the engine can be released.

We are currently recruiting!
To join BlueFusion, please post your resume in the following format:

MSN: (What is your MSN? This is a requirement!)
Experience: (What projects have you done? How long have you been programming? Prove to me you have skill!)
Reason: (Why do you want to be on the team?)
Offering: (What will you bring to the team?)
Other: (Any other information you'd like to include)

Only experienced programmers will be accepted!

Current State:

  • Engine set up
  • Working on client processing (almost done)

The current source can be downloaded here: http://www.savefile.com/files/1368964

Read full topic
item.source: [Project]: Server from scratch, Project BlueFusion - Recruiting
